intro: Escobaria dasyacantha subsp. chaffeyi, commonly known as Chaffey's liveforever, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. Its unique morphology and resilience make it a notable species in desert ecosystems.
